intro: Scorzonera resedifolia, commonly known as the Turkish scabious, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and the Mediterranean. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant features silver-gray, hairy leaves and produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Scorzonera resedifolia is valued in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
